item.title: Wireless Penetration
item.author: blackvolga@pm.me (GAZ23)
item.description: Posted without comment (no pun intended) Don’t try this at home, kids! Random Musing: this could probably be done on a Pi or similar. Inside Jokers’ Lair Boot Kali Light As of 2019.03: apt-get update && apt-get -y upgrade && \ apt-get install -y gcc git make \ libcurl4-openssl-dev libssl-dev zlib1g-dev git clone https://github.com/ZerBea/hcxdumptool && \ cd hcxdumptool && make install # run for 30 secs to confirm capabilities

item.title: Ryzen2 Memory Overclocking
item.author: blackvolga@pm.me (GAZ23)
item.description: Overclocking is not an exact science nor does it require a degree in rocket surgery. Ryzen processors are more sensitive to memory clock speeds than you may be used to. Fortunately Zen2 is affected far less so than predecessors, making previously obscure clock speeds far less ambitious.

item.title: Arch Linux VFIO 2019
item.author: blackvolga@pm.me (GAZ23)
item.description: An incredibly opinionated attempt at updating the Arch Linux VFIO install notes for late 2019 from a disparate collection of sources.

item.title: Rooting Pixel 3
item.author: blackvolga@pm.me (GAZ23)
item.description:
Our very first drop test immediately confirmed initial suspicions about the questionable design decision to accommodate wireless charging by using the thinnest possible moulded plastic for the rear body (wrapped in glass no less!).

Needless to say, we’ve gotten pretty good at flashing and rooting the Pixel 3.

item.title: htaccess woes
item.author: blackvolga@pm.me (GAZ23)
item.description:
A popular jQuery upload plugin used .htaccess for security control but the default behaviour in Apache changed 8 years ago (v2.3.9) so attackers have been able to upload payloads using the plugin ever since.

Luckily it’s only the 2nd biggest jQuery repo on GitHub that’s been forked 7,834 times!

item.title: Unboxing VirtualBox
item.author: blackvolga@pm.me (GAZ23)
item.description:
Talk by Niklas Baumstark from Insomni’hack 2018

Many of these bugs have probably been around since 2001.

item.title: wsl
item.author: blackvolga@pm.me (GAZ23)
item.description: Sometimes we all get stuck on a windows machine. Luckily, since the March 2018 Update, Windows Subsystem for Linux has grown into a surprisingly superior alternative to the likes of cygwin for your basic terminal needs.
